ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to use Heritri?
ygData.msgSnippet: That site doesn t currently resolve for me. I m not sure what you mean for Results ; are you trying to crawl a search engine s results page? If so, be aware

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=4wI1gzFtu1-VGTZY4oW95S2QRtjZBoyzfwP-00Gd3_pf
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

That site doesn't currently resolve for me.

I'm not sure what you mean for "Results"; are you trying to crawl a 
search engine's results page? If so, be aware most search engines ban 
robots from their results pages.

In your private mail, you included a 'scope' configuration which only 
had one DecideRule, to accept URIs of your patterns. Working scopes have 
many rules, including some to support the fetching of prerequisite URIs. 
As you forwarded your scope, it would not accept a seed URI (such as a 
search engine results page) that did not fit the pattern, nor allow 
certain preqrequisite fetches to complete.

I always recommend starting with a default, working scope, then 
incrementally changing it to match your needs -- leaving most of it 
unchanged.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
